thread.title: Fall concert, Boston music at Rock City
thread.title_full: Fall concert, Boston music at Rock City

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Fall concert, Boston music at Rock City
text:
Fall concert, Boston music at Rock City Oct 22, 2015 Alex Calabrese performs as Neversink. 
Rockland — The Rusty Hinges will perform its fall concert Friday, Oct. 30, from 7 to 9 p.m. at rock City Café, 316 Main St. On Halloween, Boston-based Neversink will perform during the same hours. 
The Rusty Hinges plays country folk and blues in an upbeat, as well as traditional style. The Midcoast group features Nancy Jones (vocals, guitar, penny whistle and fiddle), Cindy Millar (vocals, mandolin and fiddle), Brian Dunn (vocals and mandolin), Chuck McGregor (bass) and Dick White (guitar). 
The lynchpin of the evolving is Alex Calabrese’s writing, and the guitarist and vocalist performs solo except when in Boston, when he pairs up with Galen Fraser. The musicians met a couple of years ago, when Calabrese had a solo residency at The Lansdowne Pub, across the street from Fenway Park. They are joined on Neversink’s debut CD by drummer Scott Burn of Scotland. They await the anticipated release of their debut record, “Born of Words.” 
Rock City’s menu is available until closing. For more information on this and other events happening at the coffeebar/cafe, call 594-4123 or find it on Facebook. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com. The Rusty Hinges
